THORACENTESIS NOTE
Date: [REDACTED]
Patient: [REDACTED] | MRN: [REDACTED] | Age: 78M
Attending: Dr. Linda Harris, MD
Location: [REDACTED]

INDICATION: New moderate left pleural effusion on CXR. Patient with history of CHF and recent pneumonia. Diagnostic thoracentesis to evaluate etiology.

PROCEDURE: Ultrasound-guided diagnostic thoracentesis, left

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Patient [REDACTED], leaning forward. Ultrasound id[REDACTED] moderate free-flowing left effusion. Entry site marked at 8th ICS posterior axillary line. Skin prepped with chlorhexidine, local anesthesia with 1% lidocaine.

22G needle introduced under real-time ultrasound guidance. Clear yellow fluid aspirated. 50mL removed for diagnostic studies.

POST-PROCEDURE: No pneumothorax on ultrasound. Lung sliding confirmed.

SPECIMENS:
- Cell count with differential
- LDH, protein, glucose
- pH
- Cytology
- Gram stain and culture

FLUID APPEARANCE: Clear, straw-colored

COMPLICATIONS: None

IMPRESSION: Diagnostic thoracentesis completed. Await results to determine transudative vs exudative.

Dr. Linda Harris, MD
